note:
I am a freelance journalist and a person. I believe that tech is a tool, not a way of life, and that we should use it to connect with each other. I currently write for Lifehacker, WIRED, The Atlantic, PopSci, PCMag, and The Wall Street Journal.

I also enjoy brewing beer and being outside.

note: Allotment life.... Largely images and information about our successes and failures from our allotments in the centre of England. Mostly no dig, mostly raised beds apart from the fruit and potatoes which are in tubs. We keep chickens too and even though we have been doing this for a number of years we learn something new every week. It can be hard and exhausting but at the same time it can be rewarding and fascinating. We love it…

Knitting hag, garden dilitante, Trans-parent thus trans ally, ND, indentured servant to Mizzy BunnyButt, the DoodleFace, & Saga T. Monster. Wildlife stan. Appalachian in the UK. PS: I love my food, but cannot cook.
Header = Mizzy BunnyButt, a calico cat, stretched out on a printed red duvet, white belly showing.
Avatar = Saga, a German shepherd, at 4 months, sitting next to Mlle DoodleFace, a black labradoodle, backs to camera in front of a dog gate, looking through open front door.
My current interests are democracy, space, energy and learning python. I want to build my own e-paper solution, but time is against me at the moment. I talk and boost about anything that interest me.
